actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow an individual to elect a tax credit for 50 percent of his charitable contributions in lieu of the deduction allowed for such contributions.
short_title: Religious and Charitable Donors' Tax Justice Act

summary.text: Religious and Charitable Donors' Tax Justice Act - Allows a tax credit, under the Internal Revenue Code, in an amount equal to 50 percent of the amount allowable to the taxpayer as a charitable contribution deduction. Limits such credit to $500 per taxable year. Stipulates that such credit shall be in lieu of the charitable contribution deduction.

titles.title: Religious and Charitable Donors' Tax Justice Act
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow an individual to elect a tax credit for 50 percent of his charitable contributions in lieu of the deduction allowed for such contributions.
